alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 12 at 1:31PM MDT until October 13 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 9 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west to northwest winds 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 expected. * WHERE...Central Highlands and Northeast Highlands. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 7 PM MDT this evening. For the Freeze Warning, from 4 AM to 9 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing dust may reduce visibility below 5 miles at times.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
